intro: Grewia rufostellata, commonly known as the red-stemmed globemallow, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the rainy season. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its woody stems are reddish in color, giving it a distinct appearance. Grewia rufostellata is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
